oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Medal for Mexican Border Service
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The metal disc is missing the silk ribbon. On the obverse is a yucca plant, and in raised letters is "Mexican Service/1911-1917." The reverse is decorated with an American eagle with spread wings. In raised letters is "United States Army/For Service." Stamped on the edge of the disc is the number 10389. The provenance is unknown. Due to raids by Mexican bandits and revolutionaries into the Southwestern United States, the War Department deployed several divisions to curtail the activities.
